channel.title: 2 Shops 1 Npc?
channel.description: ok so im trying to make 2 pk shops that you can open from 1 npc. so when you talk to the npc theres 2 options pk shop 1 or pk shop 2 and i wanna make it 2 different shops but whenever i open either one its both the same shops, how do i make it so it opens a whole different shop.. im using a dementhium 637..

item.title: 2 Shops 1 Npc?
item.dc:creator: @RS_From_The_00s RS From The 00s
item.description:
@RS_From_The_00s wrote:

Yes but if what follows is just one line then you don’t need to use brackets.

Read full topic

item.title: 2 Shops 1 Npc?
item.dc:creator: @Skrillex_Craft Skrillex_Craft
item.description:
@Skrillex_Craft wrote:

[quote=“RS From The 00s, post:8, topic:534179”][quote author=Skrillex_Craft link=topic=652974.msg4375715#msg4375715 date=1382005096]

if (nextDialogue == 559) {
        openShop(5);
} else if (nextDialogue == 560) {
        openShop(6);
}

Something like that.
[/quote]so if i can follow those code "nextDialogue == 559
openShop(5);
}else if (nextDialogue == 560){
openShop(6);

But why the bracket in front and back off the dialogue 560?

It won’t literally be “nextDialogue” and “openShop”, you will have to find and use your source specific methods.

Why the brackets? Because that’s Java syntax. You can also do

if (nextDialogue == 559)
        openShop(5);
else if (nextDialogue == 560)
        openShop(6);

if (youWouldLikeToAccessThisShopDialogueOption) accessThisShop(shopId); else if (youWouldLikeToAccessThatShopInstead)// second dialogue option openThatShopInstead(shopId); [/quote]arnt brackets there to close a line?

Read full topic

item.title: 2 Shops 1 Npc?
item.dc:creator: @RS_From_The_00s RS From The 00s
item.description:
@RS_From_The_00s wrote:

[quote=“Skrillex_Craft, post:7, topic:534179”][quote author=RS From The 00s link=topic=652974.msg4375713#msg4375713 date=1382004722]

if (nextDialogue == 559) {
        openShop(5);
} else if (nextDialogue == 560) {
        openShop(6);
}

Something like that.
[/quote]so if i can follow those code "nextDialogue == 559
openShop(5);
}else if (nextDialogue == 560){
openShop(6);

But why the bracket in front and back off the dialogue 560?[/quote]

It won’t literally be “nextDialogue” and “openShop”, you will have to find and use your source specific methods.

Why the brackets? Because that’s Java syntax. You can also do

if (nextDialogue == 559)
        openShop(5);
else if (nextDialogue == 560)
        openShop(6);
if (youWouldLikeToAccessThisShopDialogueOption)
        accessThisShop(shopId);
else if (youWouldLikeToAccessThatShopInstead)// second dialogue option
        openThatShopInstead(shopId);

Read full topic

item.title: 2 Shops 1 Npc?
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

  1. Open a dialogue screen for the player so they can choose from shop 1 or shop 2. Try some files like dialoguehandler, I’m not sure of the file names for Dementhia.
  2. Find the action button ID for each option. System.out.println("Action button ID: " + buttonId);
  3. Have it open shop 1 for button 1 and shop 2 for option 2.

Read full topic
